Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: Universal Power Converter for AC-DC, DC-DC, DC-AC and AC-AC Applications
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this project is that it will serve as a one-stop power conversion solution across the power conversion industries. The proposed Power Converter can convert power directly from AC-DC, DC-DC, DC-AC and AC-AC in a single stage without an interim AC or DC link. The said power converter can take fixed frequency, variable frequency or DC voltage as input and can deliver another fixed frequency, variable frequency or DC voltage at the output. The voltage can be stepped up or down and the power can flow back and forth in the said power converter. Having all the power conversion features in one hardware can serve almost all power conversion applications such as aircraft/spacecraft/ship, hybrid/electrical vehicle, renewable energy, automation industry and almost all other power conversion needs by a mere change of software. Such technology has a potential to become a mass-produced commodity and in effect the cost of the power converter can be dramatically reduced across all industries, Market research organization has estimated that by 2020, the power converter market will be valued at $65 billion. Therefore, the commercial impact of this one stop power converter solution will be significant.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will introduce a multifunctional power converter with single stage power conversion. By employing bi-directional 4-quadrant wide band gap switch, intelligent filters at input and output, advanced pulse width modulation and commutation scheme a more efficient, robust, smaller foot print, low-weight power converter will be realized which will convert power from input to output much faster with reduced loss and at the same time it will not need any bulky DC or AC link in between. By operating less number of semiconductor switches at a given time the loss and size of the power converter will be reduced. By having intelligent filter, high power quality at the input and output will be achieved. The multifunctional use of this power converter will cut down the number of on board power converters in aircraft/spacecraft/ship in a system level which will provide multi-fold benefit in terms of fuel economy. By having less loss, the power consumption will be reduced and by having smaller size and weight the payload will be less, which will improve the fuel economy. By reducing number of on board power converters the on-board weight will be reduced further. Therefore, overall fuel economy will be significantly improved.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Overview: Universal Real Time Power Conversion (URTPC) LLC has developed and tested a preliminary benchtop multifunctional power converter (MPC) prototype though NSF SBIR Phase I research program. The unit is tested at 1kW power level with 110V AC and DC supply. A commercially available programmable power supply which can support DC and AC supply up to 135V at up to 500Hz frequency is used for testing the MPC. A resistive load bank is used at the output for loading. Through test it is verified that the proposed MPC can take both AC and DC power supply at the input and can deliver desired DC or AC power at the output for frequencies from DC to 30kHz AC. The project goal was to achieve up to 10kHz output frequency. Through test it is found the output frequency can be increased to 20-30 kHz. The output voltage and current waveforms for DC and AC operation are illustrated in Fig.1 to Fig. 5 to prove the feasibility of the technology. The proposed Multi-functional Power Converter will be produced as a general-purpose multiuse power converter that can be used for all major power conversion needs such as AC to DC, DC to DC, DC to AC and AC to AC in a single platform. It has the capability of interchanging the input and output ports and bi-directional power flow capability. Currently, there is no commercially available power converter for all the above power conversion needs integrated in a single hardware. This power converter will be modular and can be configured as single phase or multi-phase and can be used for all power conversion need.

 

Intellectual Merit: This Small business Innovation Research Phase 1 Project has developed and tested a preliminary prototype of a unique power converter towards achieving an all-purpose solution for the power conversion industry. Power Conversion is an essential part of today?s civilization. From household to heavy industries, aircraft to ship, micro grid to renewable utilize power converters. With one unified design, manufacturing process, sales and service channel this new technology can be made to a cost-effective faster time to market mass-produced commodity. The same hardware can be used for multiple application by just mere change of software.

A high frequency power converter Input and Output with fundamental as 10kHz and above is not available today commercially for a two-level single stage multi kilowatt applications. With Silicon Carbide (SiC) devices and with appropriate switching techniques it is found to be feasible to support output fundamental frequency even higher than 10 kHz (up to 30kHz) at 110V and 1kw power level. The feasibility of such technology at higher voltage (up to 480V) and at higher power (5kw level) are on progress. This is a preliminary design. The final goal will be to go for higher  power and ripple voltage less than 0.5%.

 

Broader Impacts:

A 1kW scale down benchtop laboratory prototype is demonstrated through NSF SBIR Phase I funding. With additional funding such as NSF SBIR Phase II and/or other sources a customer demonstration ready prototype for industrial application will be developed. This solution may become one stop solution for every power conversion need. Both economic and societal impact will be enormous. By having one Universal Power Converter, the design, manufacturing, testing, trouble shooting, sales, marketing, service, supply chain will follow one generic approach - which will certainly bring down the cost and the final sale price of power converter compared to today?s solution. So, the benefit will flow down to every level of the economy and society. By reducing the cost of power converter, the cost in renewables, electric/hybrid car, aircraft and other applications can be cut down which otherwise is expensive today and some cannot be affordable without government subsidies.
